id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id) of the script. Use this to interact with the script using the script actions.

*See also: [script Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-component)*

mode.docs:
**string**: Controls what happens when a script is invoked while it is still running from one or more previous invocations. Default to `single`.
  * `single`: Do not start a new run. Issue a warning.
  
  * `restart`: Start a new run after first stopping previous run.
  
  * `queued`: Start a new run after previous runs complete.
  
  * `parallel`: Start a new, independent run in parallel with previous runs.
  
  

*See also: [script Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-component)*

values_docs.single: Do not start a new run. Issue a warning.
values_docs.restart: Start a new run after first stopping previous run.
values_docs.queued: Start a new run after previous runs complete.
values_docs.parallel: Start a new, independent run in parallel with previous runs.

max_runs.docs:
**int**: Allows limiting the maxiumun number of runs when using script modes `queued` and `parallel`, use value `0` for unlimited runs. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [script Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-component)*

parameters.docs:
**[Script Parameters](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-parameters)**: A script can define one or more parameters that must be provided in order to execute. All parameters defined here are mandatory and must be given when calling the script.

*See also: [script Component](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-component)*

execute.docs:
This action executes the script. The script **mode** dictates what will happen if the script was already running.

*See also: [`script.execute` Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-execute-action)*

stop.docs:
This action allows you to stop a given script during execution. If the script is not running, it does nothing. This is useful right now if your want to stop a script that contains a `delay` action, `wait_until` action, or is inside a `while` loop, etc. You can also call this action from the script itself, and any subsequent action will not be executed.

*See also: [`script.stop` Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-stop-action)*

wait.docs:
This action suspends execution of the automation until a script has finished executing.

*See also: [`script.wait` Action](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-wait-action)*

is_running.docs:
This [condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) allows you to check if a given script is running. In case scripts are run in `parallel`, this condition only tells you if at least one script of the given id is running, not how many. Not designed for use with [while](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#while-action), instead try [script.wait](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-wait-action).

*See also: [`script.is_running` Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#script-is-running-condition)*
